intro: Byrsonima dealbata, commonly known as the white jambul, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by edible, fleshy fruits that contain hard, black seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is adaptable to various soil types.
